p: Our conclusion about public awareness—again, based on sparse evidence—is that most residents of developed countries know little or nothing about the health relevance of climate change, but are open to learning such information, and are inclined to believe that it may be harmful to health. Conversely, most vulnerable residents of developing nations do appear to recognize that specific climatic conditions where they live are changing, and those changing conditions are causing deleterious health impacts, although most have not ever heard the terms global warming or climate change.
